page.title: 13Local History
page.content: Ravensworth Estates. Until l965 Ravensworth castle built on the site of a l3th century monastery, was owned by the Liddell family. The Liddells, as Lords of Ravensworth, date from the time of Queen Elizabeth I and played an important part in political life as mayors of Newcastle. They became entrepreneurs, investing in coal mining. The castle, constructed of sandstone from Springwell quarries, was added on to the l5 century towers. During world war II it was used by the army and later became a girls' school. After mining subsidence caused severe damage Lord Ravensworth decided to use the castle stone for building houses within the grounds leaving only the towers. During the last 20 years the estate, houses and land were sold to meet heavy death duties.
